poem:
**Power Play**

Old reactors hum their lullabies,  
under brackish skies where seagulls spy.  
Concrete giants, timekeepers  
of dreams and kilowatt heartbeats,  
cradle black gold within their veins,  
sustain a thousand hands,  
a thousand pairs of hands.  
Fissioned futures bought a year  
by graphite and turbine whispers—  
the clock ticks onward, onward still.
